title: Mass. has one of the best nude beaches in the U.S., according to CNN
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Moshup Beach on Martha's Vineyard was named one of the best nude beaches in the U.S. by CNN.
The beach features clothing-optional and clothing-required sections, with attractions like the Gay Head Lighthouse nearby.
CNN recommends checking local laws before visiting any clothing-optional beach, including Moshup Beach.

title: Driving school manager gets prison time for passing unqualified drivers in State Police license fraud scheme
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Scott Camara, 44, sentenced to one month in federal prison for role in Massachusetts CDL fraud scheme.
Camara pleaded guilty to perjury and conspiracy, falsely passing four CDL applicants without proper testing.
Federal prosecutors had sought 10 months; defense highlighted Camara's minor role and clean record.

title: Red Sox reportedly calling up pitching prospect for MLB debut, sending Dustin May to IL
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Red Sox prospect Connelly Early will make his MLB debut against the Athletics on Tuesday night.
Pitcher Dustin May goes to Injured List after recording a 1-4 record and 5.40 ERA with the Red Sox.
Early, a fifth-round pick in 2023, has a combined 10-3 record and 2.60 ERA in 2025 minor league season.

title: Mass. teen facing assault with dangerous weapon charges in road rage incident near high school
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A 19-year-old Dedham man faces multiple charges after a road rage incident near Dedham High School.
The charges include assault and battery with a dangerous weapon and malicious damage to a vehicle, police said.
The incident occurred on Whiting Avenue, and one person was treated at the scene for a hand laceration.

title: Report: Jabrill Peppers signs with the Steelers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jabrill Peppers signed with the Pittsburgh Steelers after being released by the New England Patriots.
Peppers will return to Gillette Stadium on September 21 when the Steelers face the Patriots.
Peppers replaced injured safety DeShon Elliott following Pittsburgh's victory over the Jets.

title: Live results: 2025 Boston mayoral preliminary election
author: John Waller
bullets: Boston's mayoral preliminary election will narrow the field of candidates from four to two.
Candidates include Mayor Michelle Wu, Josh Kraft, Robert Cappucci, and Domingos DaRosa.
Mayor Michelle Wu holds a significant 50-point lead over challenger Josh Kraft.

title: Survey says Mass. is happy, but not TOO happy. How about you?
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Massachusetts ranks as the ninth happiest state in America according to a WalletHub study.
The state ranks 6th for 'Work Environment' and 8th for 'Emotional & Physical Well-Being'.
Vermont ranks 29th with the fourth-highest rate of adult depression despite being top for 'Adequate-Sleep Rate'.

title: After 2024 chaos, Boston’s polling places are stocked with extra ballots
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Boston's election department is under state control after the 2024 ballot shortage fiasco.
Secretary of State William Galvin has implemented changes, including extra ballots and Poll Pads for all polling locations.
Election department communication systems have been improved following issues with overwhelmed lines during the 2024 election.

title: Man charged in unprovoked attack of woman walking in the South End
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Jose Edgardo Miranda-Martinez, 62, was charged with assault and battery and disorderly conduct in a South End incident.
The victim was allegedly punched in the face multiple times on 190 W. Canton St. and required medical evaluation.
Miranda-Martinez claimed the assault was to 'stop the game,' but did not elaborate; identity verified post-arrest.

title: Report: Four of Bill Belichick’s trademark applications have been denied
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: U.S. Patent and Trademark Office denied four Bill Belichick trademark applications for being too similar to existing Patriots trademarks.
Rejected applications included phrases like 'Do Your Job (Bill’s Version)' and 'The Belestrator (Bill’s Version)'.
Belichick's TCE Rights has three months to appeal and is awaiting examination on trademark for 'Gold Digger'.
